etymologies: Old English steorra, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch ster, German Stern, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin stella and Greek astēr

definitions: a fixed luminous point in the night sky which is a large, remote incandescent body like the sun.

notes.text: True stars were formerly known as the fixed stars, to distinguish them from the planets or wandering stars. They are gaseous spheres consisting primarily of hydrogen and helium, there being an equilibrium between the compressional force of gravity and the outward pressure of radiation resulting from internal thermonuclear fusion reactions. Some six thousand stars are visible to the naked eye, but there are actually more than a hundred billion in our own Galaxy, while billions of other galaxies are known

shortDefinitions: fixed luminous point in night sky which is

definitions: a conventional or stylized representation of a star, typically one having five or more points

examples.text: the walls were painted with silver moons and stars

shortDefinitions: conventional or stylized representation of star

definitions: a star symbol used to indicate a category of excellence
shortDefinitions: star-shaped symbol used to indicate category of excellence

examples.text: the captain has a star against his name

definitions: a white patch on the forehead of a horse or other animal.
shortDefinitions: white patch on forehead of horse

definitions: a data or communication network in which all nodes are independently connected to one central unit
shortDefinitions: data or communication network in which all nodes are independently connected to one central unit

definitions: a famous or exceptionally talented performer in the world of entertainment or sports
an outstandingly good or successful person or thing in a group

examples.text: a rising star in the party

shortDefinitions: outstandingly successful person or thing in group

definitions: a planet, constellation, or configuration regarded as influencing someone's fortunes or personality

examples.text: his golf destiny was written in the stars

shortDefinitions: planet, constellation, or configuration regarded as influencing person's fortunes or personality

definitions: a horoscope published in a newspaper or magazine
shortDefinitions: horoscope published in newspaper or magazine

definitions: (of a movie, play, or other show) have (someone) as a principal performer
(of a performer) have a principal role in a movie, play, or other show

examples.text: McQueen had starred in such epics as The Magnificent Seven

definitions: (of a person) perform brilliantly or prominently in a particular endeavor or event

examples.text: Vitt starred at third base for the Detroit Tigers

shortDefinitions: perform exceptionally in game or other event

definitions: decorate or cover with star-shaped marks or objects
shortDefinitions: decorate or cover with star-shaped marks or objects

definitions: mark (something) for special notice or recommendation with an asterisk or other star-shaped symbol

examples.text: the activities listed below are starred according to their fitness ratings

shortDefinitions: mark something for special notice or recommendation with asterisk or other star-shaped symbol
